title: Create a Google Calendar for a Group
content: Say you’d like to have a team calendar for team events, or a specific calendar based on theme (like new hire start dates and anniversaries), please see the instructions below to meet your needs. [Table of Contents] Instructions: Create a Calendar If you’d like to create a calendar that is not your personal calendar, please take the following steps… Open Google Calendar . On the left-hand side navigation menu, identify  Other calendars . Click the ➕ to select the option to Create new calendar . You will be redirected to create a calendar: Add the name of the calendar (for example, Capybara Team Calendar), Add a description, and Add a default time zone. Click Create calendar . Instructions: Share Your Calendar If you don’t want to be the sole owner of the calendar (especially in situations where you want a calendar to outlast your time with Simpli.fi ), please share with other users and/or groups. Open Google Calendar . On the left-hand side navigation menu, click the name of your newly created calendar (above) or existing calendar you wish to share. Click the vertical ellipses next to the calendar to select  Settings and Sharing . Once redirected into the calendar’s settings, scroll to the section labeled Access permissions for events . Ensure that you have checked the option to Make Available for Simpli.fi to “See all event details” if you want anyone at Simpli.fi to be able to subscribe to the calendar. If you’d prefer to only share with a couple people/specific groups, scroll to Share with specific people or groups. Click + Add people and groups . Select the Google group alias or individual email of the user. By each user or group, click the Down arrow to choose an option. Click Send . Connecting Your Group Calendar to Slack Slack used to have a Google Calendar for Teams Slack application that has since been deprecated. However, they have been working to add this functionality to their Google Calendar application. They state that theoretically, someone could connect a team calendar to a Slack channel by following their process for adding personal calendars to a Slack Channel. Please see Slack documentation for the most up-to-date status of this feature. Individual Calendar Events Transfer Through Google Workspace Administration and GAM command line, the Digital Workplace team has the ability to transfer calendar event ownership at a per-event or per-user level. [INFO] Whenever an employee transitions from Simpli.fi , the Digital Workplace team automatically transfers ownership of their calendar events to their manager. And should another user (not their manager) need to own a former employee’s calendar (or even just one of their events), we have the ability to honor that request in the #digital-workplace Slack Channel.
